title: Thursday Hill Climb
description: A challenging hill run with steady heart rate and room for improved efficiency.
detailedDescription: The run focused on hill work, evident from the significant elevation gain of 152.7 meters over just 5.21 km, which challenged cardiovascular performance and leg strength. The average heart rate of 163 bpm suggests a moderately high effort, fitting for a hill workout, while the max heart rate reaching 182 bpm indicates moments of intense exertion. However, the running efficiency score of 1.76 is slightly lower than ideal, likely impacted by the demanding terrain and elevation changes. Maintaining a cadence of 82.7 rpm is decent but could be improved to boost efficiency on hills.
goal: Focus on improving running efficiency during hill workouts by working on cadence and smooth strides. Enhancing efficiency can help maintain speed and reduce fatigue on challenging elevations.
